title: Chateau Chantal 2012 Proprietor's Reserve Krupka Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: This single-vineyard offering from northern Michigan sees 20 months in oak, of which 39% is new. At this stage, the medium toast of the oak stands out on the nose, giving aromas of charred red and black berries. The palate is more fresh in nature, with streaks of granite and black pepper lighting the way over a dark-berry core.

title: Chateau Grand Traverse 2014 Late Harvest Riesling (Michigan)
description: A mild concentration of peach, pineapple and an underpinning of floral tones mark the nose. The medium-sweet palate shows good tension and balance, with ripe yellow apple flavors meeting brisk pineapple.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Trincadeira (Tejo)
description: Also known as Tinta Amarela in the Douro, Trincadeira gives wines with firm structure while also having a juicy fruit acidity. This wine, with its red berries and red currant flavors fits the bill, a fresh wine that also has weight and density. Drink now.

title: Airlie 2012 Vintner's Blend Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Scents and flavors of beet root, rhubarb and cranberry are front and center in this stiff, tart wine with root and acidic flavors. It spent 22 months in one-third new French oak, but that doesn't register on the palate.

title: Blanco Nieva 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Clean in the glass, this SB smells like lime and grapefruit. The palate is equally citrusy in feel, with old-vine minerality. Flavors of white pineapple, tangerine, lime and grapefruit span the citrus spectrum, while the finish is sharp and angular.

title: Blustone 2013 Winemaker's Red (Michigan)
description: A blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah, this wine shows a mild concentration of ripe raspberry and bramble berry on the nose. The medium-weight palate is soft in feel, with juicy raspberry and red cherry showing a slight undercurrent of green peppercorns. A toasted praline note marks the close.

title: Erath 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: Erath's Pinot Gris is done in a solid, middle-of-the-road style that's quite reliable from vintage to vintage. Apple and peach fruit, lightly spiced, has a buttery streak running through the finish.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Dried lemon, sliced pineapple, ripe yellow apples and a squeeze of lime show on the light nose of this bottling from the Gallo family. The palate is juicy and showy, but not overbearing, with sliced apples, a pinch of salt and nectarine flavors trending toward tropical edges.

title: Marco Scolaris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This rather deeply hued, yellow-gold wine offers aromas suggesting orchard fruit, toasted almond and crushed rock. The palate shows tart apple and green pear accompanied by vibrant acidity.

title: Mari 2013 Scriptorium Sezession Brut Sparkling Grüner Veltliner (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Initial notes of yeasty citrus are lifted by pear and white blossom on the nose. The citrus-driven palate brings additional blossomy tones alongside Gala apple, with a slight undercurrent of bitter grapefruit pith. Light, fresh and clean, this sparkling Grüner is an attractive option as an apéritif.

title: Roche 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A straightforward, medium-bodied wine that's not fussy, this offers generously expansive flavors of apple skin and pear, veering toward the tropical end of the fruit spectrum on the finish.

title: Paramus 2014 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Peach and a hint of fresh lettuce are the key aromas to a basic bouquet. This feels solid but pithy, while orange and other generic citrus flavors turn slightly bitter on the finish.

title: Ronco dei Tassi 2014 Malvasia (Collio)
description: Appealing aromas of beeswax, citrus blossom, orchard fruit and crushed stone lead the nose while the zesty palate offers lemon rind, tangerine and mineral. Racy acidity gives it a clean, refreshing finish.

title: Rotta 2013 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh-squeezed olallieberries, concentrated lilacs, plum skin and a light pepper aroma show on this wine's dense nose. The palate is lighter in flavor yet dense in texture, with strong tannins framing the fresh boysenberry fruit.

title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lisboa)
description: Catty and grassy this is a very Sauvignon style of Sauvignon. It is tight, herbal and intense with a cool climate character that comes from the proximity of the Atlantic Ocean to the vineyards. Drink now.

title: Poggiobello 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: The delicate opening scents are broom, beeswax and pear. The thin palate is made up of yellow apple skin, dried herb and a hint of almond alongside nervous acidity.

title: Portal del Priorat 2013 Luno Red (Montsant)
description: Jammy plum and raspberry aromas are meaty and hint at being plush. A flush, fairly full mouthfeel packs power, while flavors of plum and prune fade toward herbal, with residual weight to the finish.

title: Tolloy 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: This offers delicate aromas of spring blossom and pear while the straightforward palate presents white peach and Granny Smith apple. Zesty acidity gives it a crisp finish.

title: Notro 2012 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Subtle red fruit aromas show a flash of lemon peel. This medium-bodied Malbec is regular in every way—the flavors are a touch earthy, with spice and plum notes. The finish hums along while offering nothing new.

title: Hawthorne 2013 Barrel Reserve Chardonnay (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: The nose is mildly expressive, with zesty lemon in the forefront. The palate is a shows more intensity, offering juicy peach notes supported by a silky texture. Having spent eight months in 35% new oak, this trends toward a fruitier-style Chardonnay, with oak lending textural support.

title: Haywood 2011 Morning Sun Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: From another section of the Los Chamizal Vineyard, Morning Sun is taut in red cherry and raspberry, a citrusy component giving it lightness and zest. Leather and black pepper come to life on the finish.

title: La Gitana 2014 Rosa Nautica White (Rioja)
description: Grapefruit and other citrus aromas are zesty but standard. That's also how the palate comes across: citric and juicy, but average. Flavors of orange and tangerine finish fresh but continue the one-note theme.

title: Zimri Cellars 2010 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Moving into maturity, this late release has softened tannins, secondary fruit flavors, and accents of leather and wet hay. Drink up.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)
description: Oak aging in large barrels has served to give this wine an immediate appeal. It's balanced, lightly structured and full of juicy fruits. Black currants, spice and red berry flavors enhance the fruitiness of the wine. Drink from mid-2016.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada

title: Cepa 21 2014 Hito  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Candied black-cherry aromas are typical of Ribera del Duero. In the mouth, this is tough, wiry and cheek-sapping. Berry and loud oaky flavors finish with a drawing sense of raw tannins along with peppery, bitter notes. The more air this gets, the better it will show.

title: Caldaro 2014 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Delicate scents of white flower and apple skin carry over to the brisk palate along with a hint of nectarine. A touch of mineral marks the finish.

title: Caldaro 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: This straightforward white offers subdued aromas of banana, orchard fruit and wildflower while the slender palate shows tangerine zest, rennet apple and a mineral note. Brisk acidity gives it a crisp close.

title: Acacia 2013 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From great farmers and a great site, this wine somehow never comes fully to life, offering a muted taste of cherry and strawberry around minty dollops of earth and dried herb.

title: Antucura 2013 Intuition Cabernet Sauvignon (Vista Flores)
description: A bouquet with tomato leaf, spice, dust and saucy berry aromas sets the stage for a basic feeling palate. Saucy red plum flavors are offset by sweet, oaky molasses notes, while a touch of nutmeg and oak character rise up late.

title: Bel Lago NV Red (Michigan)
description: Blending Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Lemberger and 12 other varieties, this is a veritable kitchen-sink blend, but with verve. Dark and brambly on the nose, with fresh cut herbs and shots of red cherry, the medium-bodied palate follows suit and prickles with specks of black pepper. Zippy acidity and mild tannins make this a well-balanced offering, great alongside pizza and pastas.
